website_summaries.verdict: A great fighting game stick for novice and advanced players that can — and should — be modded to get the most out of it.
pros: Compatible with Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, and 10, as well as a variety of gaming systems
Has arcade-style lever and button placement
Solid, heavy construction, with rubber feet for stability
cons: You have to have an Xbox or PS controller plugged into it when using it with an Xbox or PS
Joystick has a square restrictor plate under it, which should be upgraded to get a better range of motion

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy and likely works for most games
customer_reviews.text: It just didn't work well for the game I wanted to use with it. PACMAN ! It works but the delay is so bad, pacman doesn't turn exactly when you want him to. I have a high end gaming rig and pacman doesn't require much resources. Also, since the stick worked fine on another arcade type game(Galaga), I think the stick just isn't sensitive enough high reaction type games such as pacman ms-pacman, dig-dug, qbert..etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dougm

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this POS for Pacman and Ms Pacman and low and behold it is just a piece of Garbage ,it will not turn Pacman at least 25 percent of the time. Couldnt even clear one board. Played with all the turbo NONSENSE buttoms to no avail.Returning this thing right away.What a hassle...Do not buy , unless you enjoy wasting time opening it up playing with setup and seeing it will not turn Pacman. Can only imagine how badly other games work. Durability a joke
customer_reviews.author: mercs

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was the pad itself so I tested it out on my PC and it worked fine. Even updated the firmware to the latest one ...
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to use this for DBFZ open beta but nope not happening. Can not connect it to my PS4. Thought it was the pad itself so I tested it out on my PC and it worked fine. Even updated the firmware to the latest one just in case. Very disappointing, was really excited to use it and had all these ideas to customize it. Guess I'll have to get a better stick. Not sure how everyone else is connecting it to their PS4 but I can only think that it's not connecting properly due to the latest system update on the console, but who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Kae Khounsak

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best cost performance arcade stick and great for HitBox conversion
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 x F300 Elite and 1 x F500 Elite already. Recently I have purchased this F300 for HitBox conversion. I think it is enough high quality parts used even it is not Sanwa parts as I tested before remove lever . It can work almost all current gaming hardwares. (I only tested with Switch, PS4Pro, Steam with XInput though). After I converted to HitBox style, I can use all platform as same as before. So I'd suggest this for first time purchase of arcade stick. If you are picky person, following might be better. Note: Elite model has used Sanwa lever and buttons. F300 Elite for possible HitBox conversion. F500 Elite for no HitBox conversion.
customer_reviews.author: CZI

customer_reviews.title: buttons randomly sequenced, joystick needs mod
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for MAME (via OpenEMU) on OSX. while the physical build quality is excellent, and the emulator recognizes it is the proper MFG + model number, the buttons seem to be randomly numbered, and each and every game requires me to build a custom configuration. Secondly, I am no expert on "restrictor plates", but playing games like PacMan and Donkey Kong, it constantly misses a transition from, say, right to UP. I've done SOME reading on this and it looks like I may need to buy some parts and mod it to get it to perform as I hoped... was thinking this was a plug-and-play peripheral. it ain't that.
customer_reviews.author: G. B. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This is an 8-way! NOT a 4-way
customer_reviews.text: I noticed some people were asking if this comes with a 4-way joystick or an 8-way joystick and I can confirm that this has an 8-way joystick. I was basically tricked into buying an extra joystick with an octagonal restrictor plate because I wanted an arcade fight stick that came with an 8-way joystick and when I searched for answers on whether or not this fight stick came with one, people were saying it was a 4-way or was unsure what kind of joystick it had.
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: My only gripe is no way to trigger the L3/R3 buttons
customer_reviews.text: There is no switch or buttons for L3/R3. I would have been fine even if they were tiny buttons like the select and menu buttons, but they don't exist. Also R stick is not able to be pressed. For PS4/Xbox One, you can keep your controller next to you just in case you need to press them, but it's a no go on Switch. (as it doesn't work in "game console" mode) Size of the board is also kind of cramped, already thinking about getting a custom case and transferring everything over. It's a really good stick for the price. The buttons and stick are actually just fine, so even though they are easily changed out, there isn't much need.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner universal joystick
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my old fightstick was PS3 only and would not work on a PC no matter what. The F300 worked smoothly with PS3, and after a bit of fiddling with Steam I was able to get it recognized and working in games there as well. It feels exactly like my old MadCatz SF4 stick, and although the buttons and stick don't appear to be Sanwa, they work well enough for a casual player like myself. As a plus, it comes with an 8-way gate so you can swap it out without having to buy anything extra. Overall, a great investment if you want to get an entry level stick for yourself or a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Read only if you aren't a fighting game veteran~
customer_reviews.text: I'm terrible at fighting games and I'm slowly using this to learn how to fight with a stick to see if I can't get better. Maybe I'm SO terrible I can't seem to get any better with this thing so I can't judge it for that...I will, however, judge it based on it's other factors. This thing feels clunky, and having to plug in another controller just to use this beast is a bit cumbersome, but for the money it is an okay product I guess. Just okay. I'd recommend reading a review from someone who knows what they are talking about. Consider my review a casual review for the non-fighting gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron S Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Good fightstick for the price and upgradable.
customer_reviews.text: Really good fightstick. No connection problems. Buttons are a little less springy than Sanwa Denshi buttons. Standard button wiring. Louder, longer throws, and less resistance than a Sanwa JLF joystick. I personally feel it's comparable with a 2lb. spring and 1mm oversize actuator. Everything is standard sized but restrictor gate has 4 phillips in addition to the normal 4 tabs. If you're going to put a Sanwa joystick in it, you'll need a 5Pin 2.54mm Pitch Female to Female JST XH Adapter Cable 30cm.
customer_reviews.author: ct

customer_reviews.title: Works on All consoles including Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on all consoles. A new firmware came out last week that allows this to be used on a Nintendo Switch. You need firmware version 1.13 available on the Mayflash website. Instructions on how to update are available with the firmware download. Works fine on Raspberry Pi for Retropie. Easily modified to use Sanwa joysticks (though you need a 5 pin cable) and Sanwa buttons. I find that I like the Sanwa joystick with the Kowal 1mm actuator from Focus Attack.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good, Sturdy and Budget Friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This fighstick is excellent as it comes from the factory works quite well, since I bought it I've been playing Street Fighter 4 with charging players like Balrog and Guile and the stick is good, the buttons are good, even so I know that all this can improve with SANWA parts. In conclusion this is a good Fightstick to learn how to use a Stick without spending too much even buying the Sanwa pieces this is still a budget friendly project.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The stick became much better after replacing the joystick and buttons (approximately a $40 upgrade). It still feels a little too small on the area for the left hand, but it doesn't seem like that space is worth the extra $30 of the F500. Buy this if you think you want mod it later, as its main boon is its multiplatform support and cheap price. Additionally, I couldn't get the firmware update to work, but I haven't tried hard. I'm not docking any points for this, but it really should be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Yilmaz

customer_reviews.title: An perfect stick for those wanting to get into fightsticks
customer_reviews.text: This is the first fight stick I ever bought and it was a perfect first step into the hobby of fight sticks. My main draw was the low price. The stock stick and buttons are completely serviceable and work fine but I almost immediately bought new buttons and a new stick from Sanwa. The original stick and buttons were a little mushy but not detrimental to play. Overall it is a base model meant to be upgraded which I did :P
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for PC average for console because of the loss of use of the headphone jack on your controller
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Mayflash F300 which came with a square gate... Felt like crapy until i replaced it a Sanwa 8way gate. Now this stick is near perfect. I see no reason not to make this upgrade. If you are thinking of getting a Mayflash F300 for console gaming don't. Get the F500 instead so you can plug in your 3.5mm headphones directly into the stick instead of having to plug a usb headset into your console. Headphones do not work while plugged into your controller which will have to be plugged into the f300 for it to work with your Xbox or PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo T

customer_reviews.title: Got a used one...
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, found the switch description plate already peel off and fall off from the top case of the stick. I was very unhappy about the item I received. The protection films on top of stick case are all wrinkle and peeling off from corners (with some damage). That indicates this joystick already be used before. I decided to return this item immediately. Not a good purchase experience.
customer_reviews.author: airroger

customer_reviews.title: Very good arcade joystick for the value
customer_reviews.text: Stick has some heft to it. Feels solid. Doesn't feel cheap or hollow. Has all the functions I was looking for on a PC arcade stick. Comfortable playing old arcade games. Can switch between D pad and analog stick inputs for joy stick controls. On my PC I tried it with Ultra Street Fighter IV and Final Fight fron the Beat Em' Up Collection. Overall felt it was very responsive with no detectable lag. Oh and it has turbo button setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Novacek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stick to use, for beginners...
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner level fight stick, this is basically the perfect stick to use at first. Once you are more comfortable with using fight sticks I would recommend grade one or upgrade the stick. The buttons are basically perfect. The stick on the other hand, if you are new to using fight sticks (arcade sticks) it will take some time to get used to. Just a brief warning, you (may/might*) want to change the stick if you are planning to use this for playing any of the Tetris: The GrandMaster games.... *Based on game-play preference.
customer_reviews.author: Agentw2012

customer_reviews.title: total fail
customer_reviews.text: got the device fast next day and within 10 mins of attempted use it never worked and on top of the fact that you have to plug in your ps4 controller into the joystick to use the joystick .... major fail .... and here i thought the usb port on the joystick was at least an optional port for charging other devices totally wrong there .... very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a pac man game but didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I solely bought this so I could play pac-man. It didn't work. The joystick was too loose and did not move quickly. I returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent affordable joystick.
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner stick it hits all the sweet spots.1. Can use on multiple consoles 2. Upgradable. The quality and price point are excellent. And to my surprise a octagon gate restrictor was also inculuded. Very solid joystick that should last for some time. Highly recommended for beginners that want versatile joystick. Really the best value at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Geeman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: When plugged into the controller, it takes forever to recognize it and when it does theres no guarantee that it was connect to the system. It consistantly refuses to stay connected and would even stop working mid-game, and I only got to use it once before it became too frustrating to even try using again.
customer_reviews.author: Wedge3163

customer_reviews.title: Made my fighting game experience on PC better.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price. Easy to customize. As you can see on my pic below. I replaced the stock buttons with Sanwa buttons because I don't want it to be monotonous and I also replaced stock square gate with a Sanwa octagon gate to make the joystick movement better. I'm using it on my PC and it never gave me any issues when I installed it. Before I bought this fight stick, I started with my keyboard, then an Xbox one controller and a PS4 ( DS4 ) controller. This is the best out of 4 mediums cause it was nostalgic and I have a better control of my character. Overall 4 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: BGLoscar

customer_reviews.title: So far..so good
customer_reviews.text: For being a lower priced, entry level fighting stick, it's great for the casual gamer. The stick appearance is easy on the eyes, the setup was easy for my PC, just plug and play. The stick does comes with instructions, if you encounter any setup or operating problems.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppin4Deals

customer_reviews.title: This stick is responsive and sturdy, a little loud though
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are mostly responsive, its not too bulky and feels well put together, it works with any console or PC and has some turbo options that toggle on/off for individual buttons which is really dope. its kind of noisy especially the stick, the buttons work great most the time, you can't play super soft with them though, but as long as you are an aggressive button pusher like me it'll won't hinder you. For the price the value is great, i really wish the stick wasn't so clicky though. I've heard its common for people to buy nice sticks and buttons and then put them in these frames. i've considered it myself because its probably annoying for group play.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality arcade stick for not a lot money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, feels well made. Pre-installed with a 4 way, however the product includes a 8 way plate. Easy to open up underneath and change the buttons and if you want to stylize your arcade stick with different color from other manufacture. Comes with cable to hook up for other system.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Great Joystick
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It worked great out of the box, but I ended up modifying it with Sanwa buttons and a Sanwa octagonal joystick gate. Super easy to do with no soldering needed at all. It literally took less than 5 minutes to replace the buttons and joystick gate. I'm using it on a PS4 and a NEO GEO mini although it supports other systems like Xbox and PC as well. Super sturdy as well. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, once you upgrade it.
customer_reviews.text: A great all-in-one, I use it for XBOne, PS4, Switch, Neo Geo Mini, PC, and my AIWO G1000 (with custom firmware). I put in a Sanwa JLF (with an octogonal restrictor gate) and Sanwa OBSF-30 silenced buttons, plus one gold OBSF-24 for the Start button, and a Sanwa bat top. I LOVE THIS STICK!!!
customer_reviews.author: abelogan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good fight stick. I'm more than a moderate gamer. I've been getting back into fighting games and needed a good stick for the XBox One. This one adapts to just about everything - including a phone! Instructions to set it up for each are clear and easy. The footprint is larger than I expected which is what I'd hoped for. And it's got some good weight to it so it's not moving when you do! Very responsive, and a much more full featured "controller" than most sticks. I would seriously order this again knowing now what a great stick it is.
customer_reviews.author: Gorn Blackheart

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner stick
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fighstick, previously I wasn’t just using an Xbox one controller when playing tekken. I’m glad I made the switch, it’s only been a couple of days and I’m already getting used to it. While I can’t compare to any other fighsticks, the buttons do feel a bit hollow, however, I don’t mind. I find that it’s easier to input commands with the stick compared to the d-pad on a controller. I might mod the buttons and the stick later on if I don’t buy a more expensive one, but for the price this is surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Stasiak

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with ps4
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have a switch and PS4. Works great on switch, button layout is messed up, but that can be fixed. Ps4 does not work at all. I followed the instructions on the manual and the ps4 does not detect the controller at all. Not able to play marvel vs capcom 3 at all. Same with street fighter v. Extremely disappointed with this stick.
customer_reviews.author: Marcial Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Okay stick for kids, nothing wrong with the hardware ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay stick for kids, nothing wrong with the hardware but the plastic finish on the top *will* start to bubble and peel up, and if you try removing it there's a ton of adhesive residue only real complaint about the hardware of the device is that the joystick is in a square rather than an octagon, making fireball motions (QCF/QCB) clunky, so a restricted plate (for $2.) is highly suggested.
customer_reviews.author: TrueWOPR

customer_reviews.title: Great for a feeler/Budget Stick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this more as a feeler and am quite impressed with it. It does exactly as it is stated in the description, really easy to use with another console, plugs straight in for switch and pc, and for ps4/x1 connect the controller to it via usb, turn on controller than use the stick in place. The only thing I will say is the exact dimensionse are 11.5in wide, 8.5 in long, and 2.5 high as the description of the dimensions has it much wider than what it really is. I would recommend this for those that are wanting to get a feel for playing games with a stick.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Lara

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: Good starter stick. Everything is up-gradable with Sanwa joystick/ 30mm buttons or Seimitsu joysticks. stock buttons are actually pretty decently responsive but are squeaky and feel cheap. The joystick is trash, definitely get a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Drew D.

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner fight stick
customer_reviews.text: Great starter stick! I have been contemplating getting a fight stick for a long time and did a lot of research before buying the Mayflash F300. I was very pleased with the quality of the stick especially given it's price. I'm super excited to continue to learn how to best use it for games like Soul Calibur 6, Street Fighter 5, and mk11(consumables are evil). If you are new to fight sticks or are looking for the best bang for your buck, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Kman

customer_reviews.title: MUST USE BRAND-NAME WIRED CONTROLLER WITH THIS FIGHT STICK
customer_reviews.text: SF2, Dig Dug, etc etc - here I come! Of note - for consoles (like XBox 360), you MUST USE the manufacturer's BRAND-NAME WIRED CONTROLLER. You cannot get a third party play and charge cable for your wireless controller. OTHERWISE, IT WILL NOT WORK. Apparently, the same goes for third party wired controllers. (Hat tip to the YouTube reviewer who reviewed three fight sticks including the Mayflash who helped me troubleshoot this problem!!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't get scammed
customer_reviews.text: This product simply doesn't work. Not only is it made of cheap materials but they are selling items different than what is pictured. In every picture but the first you can see a dedicated front port for console control, the product they are selling does not have this. There is an alternative port on the back instead but it doesn't hold a connection if the wire moves at all (because all the materials used in this product are garbage). Expect constant disconnects for the (likely very short) lifespan of this controller. Immediate return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much lag.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play Pac-Man on PS4 and lessen the usage of my Arcade 1UP cabinet. I even bought a Sanwa 4-way gate to go along with it. There is some serious input lag if you need fast reaction time this is not the controller to get, and having to plug in a cord to the controller is a HUGE downside. For the price it seems like an okay product but the huge amount of lag makes it useless for me and you will soon find yourself wanting to replace the joystick and buttons to something more high quality, bringing your total cost to over $100 keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Casserole

customer_reviews.title: 8 Way Gate Should be Standard!!!
customer_reviews.text: Should come with 8way gate installed. Its called a fight stick not a PacMan stick, why they use 4 way as standard is beyond me. At least the F500 comes with an 8 way gate, you need to order one separately with the F300, really stupid!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good value stick
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good value stick. The instructions aren’t really clear and I didn’t realize it had three modes so I thought it was broken. If you plan to play on console shift the switch to the middle position fyi. The other inconvenience is that a controller has to be connected to it for it to work. It gets the job done though and I feel like it’s a fair value for the price
customer_reviews.author: chaadrick giles

customer_reviews.title: Fight!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to the fighting game community so I can’t tell if it’s better than any other fight stick but I can say for a beginner like myself this is awesome. I never knew how easy it was to pull off some crazy combos in MK11 till I tried this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yeet

customer_reviews.title: Decent Fight Stick for the Cost, but Annoying to Hook Up
customer_reviews.text: For the cost its a decent fight stick. I bought it to use with my PS4. Every time I want to use it though, I have to play this game of plug, unplug, log in, log out, plug back in and keep trying until my PS4 decides it sees the Fight Stick. When it is working, it functions just like you would want, its just super annoying to have to spend 5-10 min fidgeting with it, every time I want to use it. My older HORI fight stick is far superior in that regard, I can just plug that one in and it works.
customer_reviews.author: KZRSoze

customer_reviews.title: it is really good. I can't really tell the input delay which ...
customer_reviews.text: For a starter joystick, it is really good. I can't really tell the input delay which is great and for a casual gamer, it's a good buy. If your a hardcore fight-gamer, you may need to modify the stick with the Sanwa GT-Y and possible Sanwa buttons. For shoot'em ups or arcades that demand turbo button pressing, consider getting Sanwa buttons. The only problem I have with the design is the controller USB input is on the front. When sitting it on your lap, the controller chord coming toward you is a problem (Dreamcast lessons not learned).
customer_reviews.author: to much money.

customer_reviews.title: First Fightstick
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Fightstick. Never used one so it took me about a day to get used to it. Playing DBFZ on PC and flawless. I did change the resistor plate to an 8 way from the 4 way that was already installed. Looking inside it's very organized and it looks incredibly easy to install. But for those trying to get started with a Fightstick, this gets my stamp of approval.
customer_reviews.author: Wardell Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Buttons sticking right out of the box, having to order new replacements, not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Casual fighting game player, everything seemed fine at first when i opened the box, but upon inspection it seems the B/O key sticks making any combo inputs i use with that specific key mess up soooo... Ordered some Sanwa buttons to replace them, probably going to be a pain to install. Nice, especially since I had to have a second stick delivered already since the first never made it to my address and said it was delivered
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level stick
customer_reviews.text: Started taking to time to learn fighting games and I wanted to learn using a stick. Saw many reviews about this stick saying this is a great starter stick. Thought the price was decent too. Got it had I've had no issues with it. Plugs right into the PC and Steam picks it up immediately. I've had no issues with this stick.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for fighting game noobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5-year-old son who would always steal my stick (F500 model) when we played SoulCalibur together. He loves it because it is light, easy to handle, and similar enough to mine that he feels like daddy.
customer_reviews.author: Ishpeck

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Biggest problem is it disables audio from the controller making it useless for me (the ps4 doesn't have external audio support.). The controller literally takes away functionality from the ps4 The joystick feels okay but the buttons are squishy as all hell and make it hard to hit consecutively since they barely spring back up at all. All a d all I've used better for barely much more money
customer_reviews.author: Will Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I have a love hate with this thing! I mainly wanted the joy stick for pacman, which it's HORRIBLE for pacman; I want to throw it at the TV every time I play pacman with it! ! But, it's great for Galagala!
customer_reviews.author: Michael  V

customer_reviews.title: Working good with nitendo switch but not mame
customer_reviews.text: Works well with nitendo switch. But don't work with mame
customer_reviews.author: bonchul

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money and easy to mod
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the buttons, stick, I added an octagonal limiter to the new stick, plugged the new stick to a hikig 5 pin cable, I even got a skin from Decalgirl. Everything is possible and available for it. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: Good first stick
customer_reviews.text: Good first stick. If you play competitive fighting games I question the integrity of the buttons and stick to hold up over abuse but fine for now. Probably will replace the buttons with Sanwa Denshi when they stop working right.
customer_reviews.author: Titus

customer_reviews.title: Nice joystick / gamepad for MAME system.
customer_reviews.text: Nice arcade stick. I used this for a MAME system. I actually had to open it up and swap wires on 4 buttons to get it to map perfectly to my MAME config. With that wire change it worked perfectly without any special config. I have noticed the price swing quite a bit on this ...
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: used fewer than 5 times and doesn't work!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: How can you sell such an expensive product with such poor quality? Our controller has been safe and sound, not misused, not damaged, put away safely most of the time. We went to plug it in today, and the thing won't even power up. We followed the instructions and did the exact same thing we did the last times, and nothing. If you want the opportunity to remove this review, make this right.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Power issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality arcade stick. The components are good and it feels very sturdy. This stick requires more power than our Microsoft Surface Pro 6's USB port could provide. The stick is not recognized by Windows 10 when plugged in. Solution: add in a powered USB hub. That will give the stick all of the power that it needs.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeWhip

customer_reviews.title: Great for making any button rapid fire
customer_reviews.text: Great looking product out of the box. Plugged usb from Mayflash to xbox and a usb from mayflash to my elite series 2 controller and after playing around with the setting buttons it worked great. So far I only have a need to spam the A button so holding down a button that does that for you is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I can't say I regret this purchase but if I had it to do over again I would buy one of the higher end sticks. A friend let me borrow one of his and the difference in responsiveness was obvious. That's not to say that this one is bad but if you're going to shell out $80 for a stick anyway put a hundred more with it and get a good one. If you just want to test out how you like playing stick this will do.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great stick for the money + Sanwa swaps right in
customer_reviews.text: Item exactly as described. Shipping was on time. Works on PS3 through USB. Works great on raspberry pi 3. I swapped Sanwa JLF and OBSF-30 buttons into it without modification other than needing a 5 pin 2.54mm ribbon cable. The factory installed stick uses a non-adjustable square restrictor plate. Sanwa plates will snap into place. I used a octagon plate for a while on the factory unit. Felt fine, maybe a tad less resistance than the JLF.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rev. 1.1 an updated version
customer_reviews.text: Both USB in/out puts are on the top/north end of the board. Not so on previous version. Pros Cords Completely out of the way. All parts can be swapped for pro parts. Good weight, solid construction Cons *360 need wired controller, already have All 360 controller adapters require or work best with a wired 360 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Edus

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Joystick stopped ccx working after once use. Returned. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: onedanna

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for your Raspberry Pi!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Raspberry Pi!!! Just what I was looking for as I wanted a good arcade stick and didn't want to break the bank. The stick and buttons feel fine to me, but if you are a purist, you can easily swap the parts out for high end stuff. Awesome stick & value!!
customer_reviews.author: Casey JonesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best stick for 50 dollars by far
customer_reviews.text: I'm having lots of fun in MAME now. I was pleasantly surprised by the extra 8 way restrictor plate in the box. The stick came with the 4 way installed but I like the 8 way better for all games, including maze games like Ms. Pacman and Mr. Do. I'm now looking at sanwa buttons and maybe a bat joystick for upgrading. Would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Typingsux

customer_reviews.title: Great value and build.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use on your lap, solid build with responsive buttons and joystick. Plugged it into my PC and was immediately playing. Bought for SFV and wish I had gotten it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: davidwilliamdurney

customer_reviews.title: Great starter stick!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first arcade stick I've ever bought, and I must say, it's totally worth it, especially if you're just getting into using a stick or like to mod it to your liking or play style. It came with a square gate that doesn't really go well with fighting games at first, but after replacing it with an octagonal gate, it became a LOT easier to pull off those Endokukens. If you're looking to mod it yourself, I suggest focusattack.com. They've got a ton of quality parts and accessories to make this stick your own, and for cheap too. Definitely glad I found this. :)
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves his xmas gift. The buttons do feel a bit wonky but from what I've read and heard, the entire device is customizable and we plan to invest in getting some better buttons for it.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this joystick to myself for my birthday, I always wanted an arcade stick and I read a bunch of Good reviews about this one. It feels great to play my fighting games with it and the response is pretty good for every command. I have a Nintendo switch and it worked without any problem. I am not a pro player but the buttons and joystick work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael S Cortes

customer_reviews.title: Bad software but usable
customer_reviews.text: Problematic with windows 10. If you turn off your pc this will have to be unplugged then plugged back in for windows 10 to recognize the fight stick.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good stick for beginners or casual gamers like me
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good stick for beginners or casual gamers like me. The joystick itself is a bit cheap feeling, but does what it needs to and the buttons are fine too. Just put a sanwa octaginal gate on it, and it was very easy. Just one tip though, be careful when unscrewing the screws that hold the gate down, they strip real easy and are hard to get out, i ended up having to dremel one off because it stripped so bad. The new gate just snapped in and thats that. The buttons have quick disconnects on them so changing them should be easy, i think changing out the whole joystick will be a bit more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Blu

customer_reviews.title: The quality that went into this controller is so good, and I love that you can swap out ...
customer_reviews.text: Mayflash has always been a go to for me, they sell amazingly priced products with tons of use. At first i was going to give this a 3/5 but they instantly sent a replacement right away. The quality that went into this controller is so good, and I love that you can swap out parts unlike their mini arcade stick. Both amazing fightsticks, but I think for budget this is one of the best you can get!
customer_reviews.author: DualKun

customer_reviews.title: Two buttons don’t respond consistently or at all
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loves this product. However since purchasing in September Of 2019 two of the buttons have stopped responding. I only use it for about an hour to on Sundays so it’s not like it’s a succumbed to overuse. Maybe it’s just my joystick but I might look elsewhere. Disappointed because it was awesome when it was working
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Mayflash f300
customer_reviews.text: This came in defected for me, i had just gotten into tekken and wanted to take it up a notch, decided to buy this one. Went hours surfing the internet for a beginner fight stick, first the usb port wouldn’t even plug onto my Playstation 4, and the usb port for the controller was at the top not bottom, going through videos on youtube i saw everyone else’s exact model completely different. I don’t know if its a coincidence or a defect but it sure did bum me out.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best controllers out of the box at this price!! Compatible with everything, and I’m using it for all the systems it’s compatible with... zero delay, no lag, excellent joystick!!!! 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Arcade Ren

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a good stick to Mod
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good stick to Mod, this is absolutely the best money can buy (if you are thinking about the F100 - don't do it, the buttons are not compatible with Sanwa, despite what the manual tells you). In less than 24 hours, I had Sanwa Denshi buttons installed and a Sanwa JLF-8YT-SK Joystick installed. The weight of this stick is also nice, which comes in the form of a thicker bottom plate. All in all, I have $60 in the stick and $60 in parts making this my favorite fight stick at the lowest cost I've built to date.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Sabin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner but miss input happened happened by the machine.
customer_reviews.text: I think it's very suitable for beginner arcade gamer. I was using it for Tekken 7 and it's more than I can get for. It's heavy and buttons feel solid. Although, there was this one time where the joystick was keep inputting to go backwards. I had to disconnect and reconnect multiple times to get it fixed. Therefore 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Joh I.

customer_reviews.title: Great for fighting games. Not that much of clickyness of the buttons and joystick
customer_reviews.text: Works really well once you figure out how to use it properly. Response well in fighting games and the buttons are not that clicky. The downside is you have to have a controller plugged in at all times, so if your controller isn’t charged then you will have to have another fully charged controller on standby
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I am a casual but passionate fighter player, this stick works perfect tough i got to buy a circular restrictor for being able to play since i was't able to adapt to square scheme, it was easy to replace, very happy with this purchase. I was scared of something could go wrong at first since i had to to import the thing to Colombia and theres is no representation or support for this product over here.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great basic fightstick
customer_reviews.text: It's held up well over the months, no sign of wear. Let's me provide some challenge for my son, who uses a an X-Box controller.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Fairfield

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with my PS4
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set to be my beginner fightsticks. Took it straight out of the box and the thing wasnt compatible with my PS4. I had to have read the instructions 20x before realizing it wasnt something I had done, the sticks just didnt work. Even went to youtube to see if I was doing anything wrong, nothing helped. Update returned them and purchased a different set of sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great Casual Beginner’s Fight Stick
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with the quality of the stick for the price! Is it EVO quality?-probably not. But it’s a quality stick with good response time, and great for just casual or even online fighting. I play mainly SFIV and Killer Instinct, and it keeps up really well. Executing stick combos is pretty easy, and the size is great. It’s easy for finger to reach from button to button with ease. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Croft

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Good quality. Seems like they can withstand some tough treatment like an arcade stick would get. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing first figjhstick and easy to mod if you want ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing first figjhstick and easy to mod if you want to change out or add somethings to it.I have the ps4 chip so i dont have to have a conrtoller pluged into it and i also added a NEUTRIK NAUSB-W-B A/B USB FEED-THROUGH to make the cord detatchable.This is really good fightstick
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money but poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: After about 30 minutes of play the left direction stopped working. I cracked it open and one of the wires from the joystick was not properly attached to the plug that plugs into the board. It was an easy fix. All the necessary parts were there they just weren't securely fastened together. Otherwise, the stick seems like a good value for what it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great first fight stick
customer_reviews.text: Great first fight stick! The price is low but the quality is just fine. Easy to swap between PS4 and PC. Buttons are responsive though a tad loud, i swapped the restrictor plate from a square to an octagon just for personal preference but the swap was very easy as this stick is very moddable. Highly recommend this stick to anyone looking to get into them.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: The perfect budget arcade stick in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and durable as well as cheap, I recommend this stick to anyone looking to switch from a standard gamepad to an arcade stick. I find a little annoyance in the fact that I have to hook up a regular controller to it for it to work on a console, but seeing as I don't travel to tournaments or anything I don't find it *too* cumbersome. Anyone who does, however, might find some annoyance in this.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great Fight Stick. Def. Buy.
customer_reviews.text: excellent first fightstick purchase. I play on ps4 and sometimes xbox 360 at a homies house and this thing rules. Fitted a Sanwa GT-Y octagonal on it and it plays like a dream. love the customization possibilities and have almost no gripes except that the cord for the controller plug in is on the bottom. It's kind of annoying because i rest it close to me but I don't want to bend my cables. If you are on the fence about this stick, buy it. It's so versatile with systems it feels good and you can customize the hell out of it until you move to a new stick and can even transfer your parts to that one!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good! Replacing the joystick helps though.
customer_reviews.text: Like a few other reviews have said. The materials for the price are honestly astounding, especially for a beginner stick like it is for me. I picked it up and followed the advice of a lot of other people and got a sanwa stick. It feels a lot smoother to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A/X Button stuck
customer_reviews.text: I used this stick for four hours before it became what is now a paper weight until I can figure out a fix to this. After four hours of use playing games such as FighterZ, UMvsC3 and Tekken7 the A button as the main button is now sticky. Multi popping for functions. Cannot fufill moves, character select specially with 3v3 fights is hard as it random chooses up to map select each time with random chars. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Michael VelDink

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement needed.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a 5 star rating if there had been more thought put into the design. I have a physical disability which prevents finger movement so, I have to press the buttons with the knuckle of my little finger. When using the Joystick, I often hit the home button which exits me out of the game and needing to re-push it. I've often wondered why companies don't consider sending out a survey to people whom have purchased their products, this way they could get feedback from video gamer's with disabilities on how to improve their items.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for awhile now, takes all our drunken abuse on arcade nights and feels amazing to use. Glad i didn't get a crazy over priced on when this one is perfect for your first.
customer_reviews.author: Thrashbog

customer_reviews.title: Works well but a pain to set up
customer_reviews.text: Works very well but need to find more detailed instructions on how to connect to your pc. I belive after I set it to direct I'm put you need to hold start and x to change the mode from switch to pc. It does change some of the buttons around. I found this out after alot of research.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great for the price. I easily modified it with Sanwa buttons and stick. Only con is that you seemingly can’t use the mic in the Xbox one controller while using it. If you flick the input switch in he top left corner to x input, you can use the headset, but the joystick is rendered useless. Weird little thing.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: An AWESOME arcade stick once you change the buttons with Happ "clicky" buttons!
customer_reviews.text: While the Arcade stick itself is fantastic, the buttons are a bit "mushy". I replaced them with Happ "clicky" arcade button and that made ALL the difference. Now I feel like I'm back in those glory days at the arcade! Also the Turbo button option is amazing! I can blast away on those old arcade shooters without killing my hand (or the arcade stick!)
customer_reviews.author: Masked Avenger!

customer_reviews.title: Prettt bummed about this product
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved the stick, however within the first month, I realized that 2 buttons were not working properly, at this current time the 4 buttons on the left hand-side (2 on top 2 on bottom) have completely stopped working, and I have no idea why. It’s extremely upsetting as now I’m unable to play certain games. I’m really hoping this company reaches out to me.
customer_reviews.author: Emani Aikens

customer_reviews.title: Good Once It Works
customer_reviews.text: This product does not plug and play like advertised into a computer. You have to manually assign it the drivers of an Xbox 360 controller. So a point is being taken off for poor product support. That being said, this is a fine piece of tech once you get it working. Feels great to use and feels even better now that I got an octagon restrictor.
customer_reviews.author: Ensign Epic

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I’m by far no pro gamer so I got this just for fun. I am more than happy with the results. Feel like I traveled back in time playing at the arcade. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jez1er

customer_reviews.title: Good basic stick
customer_reviews.text: If you aren't looking for any bells and whistles, but just want to approximate the arcade interface at home, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: A great controller...
customer_reviews.text: I got this stick a while back and it still works great, for my PC. I mostly play Mame and it gets the job done. Highly recommended if you want something simple...
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: It does not work with Windows 10 and MAME!
customer_reviews.text: Hours trying to make it work. The joystick is recognized by Windows 10 but when going to MAME it does not recognized it automatically nor using the "tab" to configure MAME games. Completely disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Garin

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He uses it when he plays Tekken 7. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: very cool item with minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Very cool ! works for ps4 just fine. However, the joystick is very loose but still works fine but I think overtime it’ll break.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

product_meta.title: Mayflash F300 Arcade Fight Stick Joystick for PS4 PS3 XBOX ONE XBOX 360 PC Switch NeoGeo mini
product_meta.description: Features: compatible with ps4, ps3, xbox one, xbox360 and pc, android. Compatible with sanwa denshi buttons and joystick that is perfect for customization to make it your very own. (Sanwa denshi buttons and joystick are not included in the packaging and you need to buy them separately). Supports the x input and d input when being used on pc-supports the turbo functions with different speed settings you can toy with-the d-pad and x/y analog axis mode can be exchanged-a Sony ps4 controller is required when using on a ps4 game console, and Microsoft Xbox 360 or Xbox one controller is required when using on a Xbox 360 or Xbox one game console. The lever and buttons are designed and placed on same layout as the arcade style. The fighting stick has considerable heft and rubber feet, both of which work to hold the controller firmly in place on hard, flat surfaces.
feature_bullets: Compatible with PS4 PS3 XBOX ONE XBOX360 PC Android Switch NeoGeo mini
Compatible with Sanwa Denshi buttons and joystick that is perfect for customization
Supports the XINPUT and DINPUT when being used on PC
A SONY PS4 Controller is required when using on a PS4 Game Console
Microsoft XBOX 360 or XBOX ONE Controller is required when using on a XBOX 360 or XBOX ONE Console

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,813 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
